boat.full_description: Gaff on Marconi mast Ordered by Charles Plumtree Johnson as his fourth Moonbeam (two predecessors by Fife and one by Shepherd), ordered in 1914.  Next owner Henry (Nipper) Cesil Sutton who stepped the 115' above deck Marconi mast in 1927.  Was Grimaldi's Royal Yacht named Don Juvante with Prince Rainier, then sold to Count Hannibal Scotti, who installed two RR  Marine engines.  Bought for restoration in 1995 by John and Francois Murray and taken to Burmah, the Maynamar shipyard in Yangon.  Relaunched Mar 2002.  See CB April 2003.
boat.name: Moonbeam
